triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control problems in multi-agent systems (MASs) with consensus and fault tolerance.

triples.name: Radial basis function network
triples.relevance: RBF neural networks are used to approximate unknown nonlinear functions in the control system.

triples.name: Sliding mode control
triples.relevance: A first order sliding mode differentiator is employed to handle the explosion of complexity problem.

triples.name: Consensus (computer science)
triples.relevance: The paper addresses adaptive fixed-time consensus problems for leader-follower coordination in MASs.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an adaptive fixed-time controller that adjusts to unknown system parameters.

triples.name: Fault tolerance
triples.relevance: The paper addresses actuator fault compensation through the use of Nussbaum function-based mechanisms.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: The paper deals with control of nonlinear multi-agent systems using nonlinear control techniques.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: Lyapunov stability theory is the foundation for proving convergence of the control errors to origin in fixed time.

triples.name: Fixed-time control mechanism
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an adaptive fixed-time consensus control method with bounded convergence time.

triples.name: Filter error compensation method
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel filter error compensation approach to ensure fixed-time convergence.
